Sure, I can provide some tips to help you control your cravings for chocolate: 

1. Find healthy alternatives: Instead of consuming chocolate, try snacking on fruits, yogurt, or nuts.

2. Keep yourself hydrated: Drinking enough water can help reduce cravings for sugary snacks like chocolate.

3. Exercise regularly: Engaging in regular physical activity can help curb cravings for unhealthy foods, including chocolate.

4. Get enough sleep: A lack of proper sleep can affect appetite and cravings, so it's important to get enough sleep each night.

5. Practice mindful eating: When you eat chocolate, do so slowly and enjoy every bite. Mindful eating can help you savor your food and understand when you're truly full, reducing your overall consumption.

6. Limit temptation: Avoid keeping chocolate at home or at your desk at work to minimize your temptation to indulge. 

Remember, it's okay to enjoy chocolate in moderation as part of a balanced diet, but excessive consumption may lead to various health problems.
